name: Holiday Inn Express & Suites Arlington, TX

reviews.title: Right in the center of town...
reviews.text: Some friends and I all stayed at this hotel in early September, 2006. For the price of the hotel it was well worth it. The staff was pleasant and the hotel was clean. It lies smack-dab in the middle of the action, Ameriquest Field and Six Flags in which we saw both.

reviews.title: Happy with the Holiday Inn Express near Six Flags
reviews.text: The only disappointment, and it wasn't just this Holiday Inn Express was the free continental breakfast...now don't yell at me, I know it's free, but if you're going to offer something free make me rave about it.

reviews.title: Just under o.k.
reviews.text: Long story short, it was nice.

reviews.title: just under really nice
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at the Holiday Inn Express in Arlington, Texas in the non-smoking wing. The room had two queen beds, a comfortable side chair and a desk with chair. Not huge, but relatively roomy. More importantly, for us, the room included a microwave and a small refrigerator. We used both, and they were clean and worked well. The bathroom is a decent size with a tub-shower that has a great shower head. Hot water came on quickly. The tub had a few porcelain chips but it was clean.

They offer free breakfast, and it was surprisingly good. It included a sort of cheese omelette with the eggs cooked through but not hard or crusty. They also had sausage one morning and bacon the other. There is a large selection of baked goods (2 kinds of muffins, several types of bagels, regular and hearty bread) and a good selection of cereals. Also furit, yogurt, coffee, OJ, milk, apple juice, etc. Enough choices that I did not get to try them all. The front desk keeps a bowl filled with fruit and fresh homestyle cookies in the afternoon, a nice touch.
reviews.title: Very Basic
Good choice for the Arlington area
reviews.text: We were very pleased with our stay in this hotel. The room was clean and updated. The bathroom was clean and had plenty of lighting which you don't find often in hotel bathrooms. The free continental breakfast each morning was fresh and had plenty to offer. The staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful regarding attractions/directions in the Arlington area. There is a trolley service, free of charge for guest, which stops directly in front of the hotel lobby. The only complaint I would make is that the in-room coffeemaker was not clean. Overall, the location is excellent, and the hotel is above average for a weekend trip.

reviews.title: Good hotel
reviews.text: Above average hotel with great staff,ideally located for Six Flags & The Ballpark.Rooms are clean & the breakfast is good...only complaint is that the pool is small.

aka: Holiday Inn Express And Suites Arlington, Tx
description: Holiday Inn Express offers the best price and location of any hotel in Arlington TX. Contact us today to stay at our affordable hotel, located near Six Flags, Rangers Ballpark and Cowboys Stadium!
